resources.string: TapTap Accessibility Service\n\nImportant Note: No data is collected from any of your apps, this service is simply used to keep the recognition active and provide interaction with the device
Set the actions to be run when the gesture is used
Set situations when the gesture should not run an action
Set how the device notifies you when the gesture is run
Select which device\'s model to use for the machine learning component
Vibrate once when the gesture is used and the action is run
Wake the device up the screen is off (note: this will interfere with actions that turn the screen off!)
Blocks gesture for half a second after the device is plugged in
Blocks gesture when the device is on a call. Only standard calls are supported - not VoIP eg. WhatsApp
Blocks gesture for half a second when a USB device, such as a thumb drive, is plugged in
Blocks gesture when any camera app is opened. Note: This will break the skipping functionality of the Launch Camera action.
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is off
Blocks gesture when the device\'s screen is on
Blocks gesture when an app is showing on screen
Blocks gesture when an %1s is showing on screen
Launch your default camera app. This action will be skipped if the camera is already running.
Open the recents by simulating pressing the recents button. On devices that support it, using this action when recents is already open will switch to the first backgrounded app
Take a screenshot using the system screenshot UI
Lock the screen by simulating the power button being pressed
Simulate pressing the toggle split screen button
Toggle the flashlight. This action will fail if the camera is in use by another app.
Launch %1s. This action will be skipped if it is already running.
Sensitivity is not currently implemented in Google\'s code that this app uses. I\'m actively looking into how it might be possible, and it may become available in a future version.

Actions are tasks that are run when you tap the back of your device twice. Actions are run in the order of the list - top to bottom. If an action is able to run successfully, no further actions will be run. However, if an action is unavailable (eg. if the assistant for a "Launch assistant" action is already running), the next action below it will be run, and so on until one is run successfully.\n\nIn future versions of this app, you will be able to add gates to actions (see the Gates menu of the app) to allow for more control of when certain actions are run.

Gates are situations that can block the gesture from running any actions. In order for any action to be run, all the enabled gates must be open.\nIf a scenario is currently met, for example if the screen is off and the "Display off" gate is enabled, no actions will be run. You can add as many gates as you like, and enable/disable them using the toggles (rather than having to delete and re-add) to make configuration quicker and easier.
The gesture will not currently work. Tap to enable
If you want to disable the gesture, tap to disable the service
Select "Tap, Tap" from the accessibility service list, toggle it and return to Tap, Tap to continue
This app is in Alpha. Tap for info.

This app is in the early stages of development and has been released in an "Alpha" state to allow for testing on lots of devices. If you encounter a bug, please report it on the GitHub as an issue. If you would like to request a feature, post it on the XDA thread or request it on GitHub.

Check back on XDA, either on Labs or in the thread, for updates as soon as they're available.

Thank you for your patience during development.
Created by Kieron Quinn / Quinny899 @ XDA\nWith thanks to contributions from the community, including: Jo√£o Dias, timfedo, Giorgio Cantoni, Fedor Shatokhin, Rodrigo Souza, Petro Bilyi, Kevin Kung
Tasker not installed or version not supported

In order to launch a Tasker task without using the Event plugin, you must enable the \"Allow External Access\" option in Tasker\'s settings. If you do not have this option enabled, this Action will always be skipped.
Show the system volume panel with the sound stream for adjustment showing
Increase the volume of the current sound stream
Decrease the volume of the current sound stream
Turn mute on/off for the current sound stream
Wake the device up if the screen is off. This overrides the setting in the feedback settings, is skipped if the display is on, and will not work if you have the \"Display off\" gate enabled
Launch a shortcut such as Google Maps directions
This shortcut is currently not supported
You need to grant Tap, Tap the \"Phone\" permission to use this shortcut Action. Please grant it in your device\'s permission settings
